meanings.definition: A substance that increases the rate of a chemical reaction without itself undergoing any permanent chemical change.
meanings.sent1: The catalyzers in the experiment made the reaction happen faster.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use catalyzers to speed up chemical reactions in labs.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student accidentally spilled the catalyzers into the wrong beaker, causing a colorful explosion.
meanings.sent4: Her encouragement acted as a catalyzer, sparking a wave of creativity in the team.
meanings.sent5: The catalyzers were like magical potions, transforming the liquid into a solid in seconds.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that precipitates an event or change.
meanings.sent1: The new policy was the catalyzers for improved efficiency in the company.
meanings.sent2: A single idea can sometimes be the catalyzers for a whole movement.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected rainstorm acted as the catalyzers for a spontaneous dance party.
meanings.sent4: His speech was a catalyzer, igniting a passion for change in the audience.
meanings.sent5: The arrival of the famous singer was the catalyzers for excitement among the fans.
